title: Fix spinner display corruption on Ctrl+C exit
description:
When exiting a C-box chat session with Ctrl+C, the loading spinners in `cbox flow status` become corrupted and fail to display correctly. This appears to be a terminal state management issue where the Ctrl+C signal interrupts the spinner animation mid-cycle, leaving the terminal in an inconsistent state. We need to investigate how spinner cleanup is handled on interrupt signals and ensure proper terminal state restoration (cursor visibility, line buffering, etc.) when the process is forcefully terminated. The spinner library may need explicit signal handlers or graceful shutdown logic to prevent this visual corruption.
